title: Is this reportable?
body: Basically toplane was dominating, bottom lane was winning hard, and Mid was somewhat even but still strong, Essentially given how the early game turned out we should've steam rolled them but the main issue came when team fights actually started breaking out, now let me emphasize this, our team was enormous, and would most likely steam roll the enemy in any fight 5v5, however there are one factor which held us back. Xin Zhao simply refused to group with us, ignoring the team entirely and even stayed splitpushing, he ignored calls for dragon, he ignored calls for baron when it mattered. What did this do? Well essentially he quietly threw the game away by allowing it to stall out. By simply farming all game when the game should've ended giving our enemy time to scale up with trist, Sona, and essentially overpowering us because Xin simply didn't want to play with the team.

replies.body: you cant report people being bad.... its just bad

I can empathize with your situation- I've played many a ranked game in my time. Sometimes, other players may see the macro game differently from how you see it, and it's likely that everyone's bound to run into players with opposing viewpoints on gameplay. If Xin Zhao was being negative, trolling, or intentionally throwing the game, then feel free to drop a report; however, if it's just an issue with the player not necessarily making a successful play on objectives, then that's not really something players should report. In the end, you should always use your best judgment on the situation to determine whether it felt like the player's behaviours were or were not in line with the community.

That is the thing though, some players might mute every player in the game (including pings) so they can concentrate on their own game. They might be in JG and just want to farm until late game, as they have muted the team (lets assume he did not tell the team his plans or that he is muting them) they wont be able to tell if a team needs help unless he looks at the map. If he does not help and keeps farming would that be considered intentional feeding? 

Just asking cause I play JG a lot and I play farm based Jg's like Shyvanna and I often get flamed for not helping the team because I want to farm up and get my items (plus dragons).

As long as you're trying to win, breaking from convention and splitpushing won't get you banned. Be sure to communicate your intentions clearly with your team. You can read more about Riot's stances on team gameplay from their Support Singed case:

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/79aGu3wR-support-singed-isnt-banable-but-thats-not-the-point?comment=006b

That's the thing. The player has muted the whole team and has not told them his plans for the games. He is playing to win just not communicating with the team. He is not using an unconventional pick he just wants to farm to level 12 or something like that. 

This is just an example by the way, I have not come across a player doing this yet.
There sued to be a "refsal to communicate with team" report, which probably catered to that but i think its a thing of the past
well because it is just him who simply doesn't know how to play objectively ????

I mean, my assumption is that is the jungler, so why are you actually trying to take dragon and baron if he isn't there?

Make the push a 4/1 push, and try to actively do something with your lead, don't go throwing it away when you don't have a smite with you.
